intro: Syngonanthus yapacanensis var. hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy whipstick, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces small, winged fruits. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
